question_sentence: Ten people were killed in a shooting Monday at a Colorado supermarket. The shooter will be in prison without bail pending an assessment of what?
choices: The likelihood of his being a danger to the public

question_sentence: Which U.S. territory had a statehood hearing Monday?
Wednesday was Equal Pay Day, but we’re not celebrating. How many years is it expected to take before women and men achieve pay parity?
After easily breaking 100 million vaccinations within his first 100 days in office, President Biden set a new goal for his administration:
choices: Every American will be vaccinated within his first 100 days

question_sentence: Cereal lovers, rejoice! This brand can finally be found on supermarket shelves this week after a months-long shortage:
Which Florida city imposed a state of emergency this week after COVID-defying spring breakers arrived en masse?
Which TV doctor is now guest hosting ‘Jeopardy!’ as of this week?
On Wednesday, the skyscraper-sized ship MV Ever Given blocked this vital waterway, cutting off more than a tenth of the world’s trade.
If you want your house to smell like a dive bar, wait until this beer brand restocks its beer-scented candles that sold out this week.
Which country just approved paid leave for miscarriages?
What is the name of the 400-metre-long container vessel that has blocked the Suez Canal after getting wedged across the busy trade route?
David Cameron is being investigated by which watchdog formed while he was prime minister?
choices: Office of the Registrar of Consultant Lobbyists
The Parliamentary Register of Official Lobbyists
Office for the Prevention of Illegal Lobbying

question_sentence: Which football team showed support for migrant workers in Qatar by wearing T-shirts bearing the message ‘Human rights on and off the pitch’ before their 2022 World Cup opening qualifier?
Which US state has become the first in the country’s south to ban the death penalty?
A three-year study has found that what sort of test can accurately diagnose concussion in rugby players?
Under newly published government plans, the size of the British Army is set to be cut from the current target of 82,000 to how many troops?
Which two high-street brands are facing boycotts in China after voicing concerns about the use of forced Uighur labour to produce cotton in the country’s Xinjiang province?
The organisers of the government’s £120m ‘Festival of Brexit’ have outlined a series of planned events including which of the following..?
choices: A series of comedy sketches about the EU
A week of tributes to the Royal Family
A celebration of the British weather
A push to ‘empower’ women through free self-defence classes

question_sentence: Allies of jailed Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny have pledged to announce a date for a new nationwide street protest after how many people sign up to take part?
How much is the fine for British holidaymakers caught travelling abroad with no good reason under new coronavirus laws?
Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin made an unannounced visit to this country this week, where the Biden administration is hoping to complete a full troop withdrawal by May 1.
evidence: The Biden administration is weighing adhering to the May 1 deadline for US troop withdrawal, an agreement the Trump administration reached with the Taliban last year.

question_sentence: Michael Kovrig is on trial for espionage charges in China, a case that has been all but closed to outside observers and has earned international condemnation. Where is Kovrig from?
evidence: Kovrig is one of two Canadians being held in China since 2018. Many view his detention as retribution following the arrest of Huawei executive Meng Wanzhou in Vancouver.

question_sentence: Canadian Pacific agreed to purchase Kansas City Southern, a mega-merger that would connect Canada, the United States and Mexico by what kind of network?
evidence: The merger, valued at over $25 billion, would connect the three countries in a single freight railroad network for the first time in history.

question_sentence: The United States and several allies, including the European Union and Canada, announced sanctions against two Chinese officials. What were the sanctions for?
choices: their undercover involvement in vaccine theft
evidence: The coordinated sanctions penalized the men for “serious human rights abuses” against Uyghur Muslims – a direct move against Beijing’s repression of Uyghur Muslims and other ethnic minorities in the Xinjiang province.

question_sentence: The United States saw its second mass shooting in less than as many weeks when a gunman opened fire at a supermarket, killing ten. In what city did the shooting take place?
evidence: The shooting happened in Boulder, Colorado, leaving ten dead including a police officer. This comes on the heels of a shooting spree in Atlanta earlier this month that left eight people dead, six of whom were of Asian descent.

question_sentence: According to new analysis from NielsonIQ, which consumer industry is seeing declining sales after experiencing a major spike at the beginning of the coronavirus pandemic?
evidence: Retail alcohol sales are down following a surge that had maintained since March 2020. The recent openings of bars and restaurants is likely one of the reasons for the decline in retail sales.

question_sentence: Who did President Joe Biden pick to lead diplomatic efforts in Central America in order to address immigration and curb the crisis at the southern US border?
evidence: Biden chose Vice President Harris to lead the effort, the first major initiative she’s been assigned. Arrivals of unaccompanied minors at the southern border has skyrocketed since Biden took office, a major point of controversy for the administration.

question_sentence: A giant container ship ran aground, blocking passage for other ships in one of the world’s most active and critical waterways for trade. Where did this happen?
evidence: The Ever Given, a 224,000-ton container ship, ran aground in the Suez Canal, blocking the entire passageway to dozens of other ships. Experts said it could take days, perhaps weeks, to get it fully unblocked.

question_sentence: Which American doughnut chain announced that it will give out a free glazed doughnut per day for the rest of the year to whomever received the Covid-19 vaccine?
evidence: Krispy Kreme announced the promotion, all in an effort to encourage vaccinations and to “get COVID-19 behind us as fast as possible,” according to the company.

question_sentence: The communications platform Slack unveiled a controversial new feature as part of the tool ‘Slack Connected,’ but immediately had to backtrack the rollout. What is the essence of the new feature?
choices: sending voice memos to anyone in the company
direct messaging users at other companies
censoring what your colleagues are saying
evidence: The controversial feature allowed users to message other users at outside companies – previously not an option.  The primary concern has been the sending of “abusive or harassing messages,” according to Jonathan Price, Slack’s VP of Communications and Policy.
